name: places/ChIJ0ZOBw8dZwokRNmXYgWUnGZM
adrFormatAddress: 1230 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: Love Glowbar! Every time I go the esthetician determines what treatments I need so it is unique & catered to my skin. The facility & rooms are very clean. I also highly recommend getting the monthly membership. It’s only $55/mo & helpful to have that reminder to keep up with my facials.

text.text: Love Glowbar! Every time I go the esthetician determines what treatments I need so it is unique & catered to my skin. The facility & rooms are very clean. I also highly recommend getting the monthly membership. It’s only $55/mo & helpful to have that reminder to keep up with my facials.

originalText.text: I’ll start by saying I loved a lot of aspects of Glowbar, the space, the staff, the ease of booking and the fact that they incorporate skincare devices into the facial. Where I usually go for extraction facials (which is also less expensive and a longer session) it’s just the extractions and a healing mask after. Skin looked great immediately after my session, but when I got home I realized not much was extracted from my face at all. Three spots in particular I pointed out before my session and my facialist said she got them, but they’re still there. It doesn’t feel like much was done for what I said I needed before my brother’s wedding. Wanted it to work so badly, so slightly sad it didn’t.

originalText.text: Love coming to glow bar, every location is really convenient where ever you are in the city. Every facial is tailored to your needs.My fav aesthetician is Kayla who always leaves me glowing.

text.text: Love coming to glow bar, every location is really convenient where ever you are in the city. Every facial is tailored to your needs.My fav aesthetician is Kayla who always leaves me glowing.

originalText.text:
We scheduled an appt online and spent $25 on a taxi. When we arrived they said they were unable to fulfill the appointment. They had tried texting 10 min before the appt but I did not see it. I spent $50 in a taxi fair to celebrate my daughter's 13th birthday and they could not accommodate the scheduled appointment.

Update: I did receive a call back from the manager and she was very apologetic and did her best to try and make it right. Customer service recovery goes a long ways.

Update: I did receive a call back from the manager and she was very apologetic and did her best to try and make it right. Customer service recovery goes a long ways.

originalText.text: I had my first experience at Glowbar last week but definitely not my last. I love a good facial but I have always felt I don’t need the full spa experience (or price). The Glowbar UES space is bright and clean, it was bustling with great energy when I came. I checked in, washed my face and was seated no more than 3 mins before my esthetician came to get me for my service. Kimmy was excellent; friendly and informative but left me to silently relax with my mask (note: LOVE that Glowbar asks pre-booking how chatty you want your service to be! What a brilliant move for an introvert like myself). Post-service, my skin was soft and glowing for days. I travel to NY often for work and will definitely be back. There are enough locations that I know I’ll be only minutes from an affordable, efficient facial that will have me looking radiant for my meetings.
